intro: Trichocentrum perezii, commonly known as the Perez's orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its clustered growth habit and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. The plant features long, slender pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients, typical of many orchid species.
